From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To specify the menu item to use as the default, use the **menu default** command in global configuration mode.

ParaDef.Info: Name of the menu. You can specify a maximum of 20 characters.
Number, character, or string key of the item to use as the default.

Examples: In the following example, the menu user exits the menu when pressing Enter without selecting an item:
menu Access1 9 text Exit the menu
ExtraInfo: Use this command to specify which menu entry is used when the user presses Enter without specifying an item. The menu entries are defined by the **menu command**and **menu text** global configuration commands.

RelatedCmds.description: Specifies underlying commands for user menus.
Specifies the prompt for a user menu.
Specifies the text of a menu item in a user menu.
Creates a title, or banner, for a user menu.
